item.title: Footpath been closed, 3rd October
item.description:
The path has been close for months now with no action. The first few fences were pulled down, it makes no sense have fenced it off with no action. However, some of the houses down there have reported subsidence which may be related to the path issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This Public Right of Way has been in use for at least 90 years and leads from the top of Corndean Lane down past Wadfield Farm. About three years ago the landowner did various unofficial works to this path including installing a cattle grid. This makes it impossible to use the ROW safely. There is no gate beside it to keep the path open and accessible. The landowner has created his own unofficial 'permissive path' on which there was no public consultation. This path is not only overgrown but also has barbed wire at a low level which could harm a child. There should be a pedestrian gate beside the cattle grid so the original ROW down the lane can be accessed safely. The ROW sign was moved by the landowner then moved again by GCC, but it was located not beside the ROW but halfway between the actual ROW and the landowner's 'permissive path.' It should be pointing down the lane towards the cattle grid as it was before the landowner moved it., 3rd October
item.description:
It's at the top of Corndean Lane at the turning to Humblebee Cottages and the back entrance to Wadfield Farm, GL54 5AL. This issue has been present since 2020. There has been much public protest and a petition regarding issues with this ROW that the landowner created. Safe acess on the ROW with a pedestrian gate and correct ROW signage has still not been rectified.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corndean Lane, Sudeley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose drain cover on Charlton Court Rd, 3rd October
item.description:
There is a loose drain cover on Charlton Court Rd close to the parking for Coronation flats. I have uploaded a close up of the cover and a distance shot showing its location as there are 2 covers close to each other. The one that rattles is closest to the telegraph pole shown in the photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Beaufort Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ash Tree located on Highway land problem, 3rd October
item.description:
One large ash requiring felling. 11kv OHC present and requires power outage. Job postponed from ADB scheduled closure for July 2024 due to an RTA close to the location of the tree. Western Power to assist.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 3rd October
item.description:
The verges have recently been cut on the hill however the section of hedge running past my property have not. This is a council road and should be maintained as well as the rest of the hill, but is often left. Please can this be rectified?

item.title: Impassable for a weasel let alone a horse due to brambles, 3rd October
item.description:
The bottom 1/3rd of the bridleway is completely impassable due to brambles one side and barbed wire fences the other. It's too narrow for anything other than a snake: dogs, people and least if all horses can get through
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentley Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 3rd October
item.description:
Please attend to blocked gullies at above address. See photos. Severn Trent have attended and confirm this is a Highways responsibility ref 13809471. We gave reported this issue on several occasions and had no response.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown willow blocking light from lamp, 3rd October
item.description:
The overgrown willow tree on land between number 14 and Number 16 Bramble Chase is blocking light from the street lamp and shedding lots of branches over the road. There is another tree which has come down and is blocking the path between Bramble Chase and Finlay Way. This path is in constant use by families going to schools and shops from Cleevelands Estate
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Bramble Chase, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
